{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3688523,"name":"billbo911","username":"billbo911","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billbo911/{size}/110890_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T15:04:30.970Z","cooked":"

I have been super blessed to be able to work with a LOT of really smart Comp Sci students. One of the things they have been able to convince me of is the benefits of using Linux, or one of it’s many dirivatives, over Windows. Sure, my daily driver is still running Windows, but I am moving away from it slowly and gradually.
I have really been impressed with the performance gains of Linux over Windows when it comes to lower powered PC’s like the ones donated to the team on a regular basis.

I have attempted to try running all FRC associated software and utilities, whether from NI, Rev, CTRE etc., on Linux and been sorely disapointed with the results! (VSCode is one exceptions).

So, for the love of all things Holy and Good, PLEASE give us Linux support when we move to Systemcore.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":120,"updated_at":"2025-07-24T15:04:30.970Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":60,"reads":857,"readers_count":856,"score":841.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504602,"topic_slug":"systemcore-please-support-linux","display_username":"billbo911","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":25}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"KN6MPS, WRWZ842"},"post_url":"/t/systemcore-please-support-linux/504602/1","custom_user_title":"KN6MPS, WRWZ842","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":25},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":28,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3688526,"name":"CJ Brandi","username":"cjb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cjb/{size}/266658_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T15:12:28.860Z","cooked":"

As much as I also love Linux, I think the reason that at least First/NI hasn’t had ds/game tools support for Linux or even Mac OS, is because it would put so much more trouble onto the poor csa. Diagnosing problems during, before, or even after matches with one operating system is hard enough. When you throw 2 more types into the mix, it’s just so unpredictable, especially with Linux being so complex. So as far as game tools is concerned, I don’t think we are getting ports soon, but for any other tool like phoenix tuner or rev hardware client, I think we should encourage ports for those. Sadly, at the end of the day, there is a standard and most companies don’t want to put in the extra work to get it working. Sad for the consumers sometimes, but that’s just reality.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":120,"updated_at":"2025-07-24T15:12:28.860Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":838,"readers_count":837,"score":512.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504602,"topic_slug":"systemcore-please-support-linux","display_username":"CJ Brandi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":22}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73447,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/systemcore-please-support-linux/504602/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":18},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":22,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688529,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T15:13:17.833Z","cooked":"

I’m also in favor of supporting Linux, but I don’t see the performance difference between Windows and Linux as being relevant to FRC usage. Even on the older laptops (so old they can’t be updated to Win11), we weren’t going to see a performance leap by changing OS.

My hope that Linux will be supported is mostly driven by the fact that that increases the chances the MacOS will also be supported, which would allow me to use my usual laptop.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":120,"updated_at":"2025-07-24T15:13:17.833Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":782,"readers_count":781,"score":311.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504602,"topic_slug":"systemcore-please-support-linux","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/systemcore-please-support-linux/504602/3","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688570,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T15:48:34.087Z","cooked":"
cjb:

is because it would put so much more trouble onto the poor csa.

What would you think of them offering a Linux/Mac DS but for “unofficial use only.” Teams can use it during development but at competitions you are forced into windows? Or maybe you can use it at competitions but CSA’s aren’t expected to offer support.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":120,"updated_at":"2025-07-24T15:48:34.087Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":706,"readers_count":705,"score":321.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504602,"topic_slug":"systemcore-please-support-linux","display_username":"Owen Busler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23320,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/systemcore-please-support-linux/504602/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688574,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T15:54:12.313Z","cooked":"

Systemcore, PLEASE support Linux

software and utilities, whether from NI, Rev, CTRE etc.

PLEASE give us Linux support

Who exactly are you asking for support here? Limelight, the makers of system core? Or vendors who make software for their utilities? From what I can tell, most if not all of system core interfacing is done through a web browser, which should work on all OSes.

If you’re asking for things like the rev hardware client or tuner x to support linux, that I understand. Though I don’t foresee the vendors wanting to spend time to support a much smaller user base, especially when, for the foreseeable future, every team will need at least one Windows device to run the driver station. Thankfully CTRE was able to get TunerX working on macOS. I wish REV was able to do the same for RHC, but I bet they have much bigger fish to fry.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":120,"updated_at":"2025-07-24T15:54:12.313Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":651,"readers_count":650,"score":225.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504602,"topic_slug":"systemcore-please-support-linux","display_username":"Tim Winters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19820,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"78 AIR Strike Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/systemcore-please-support-linux/504602/5","custom_user_title":"78 AIR Strike Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688576,"name":"billbo911","username":"billbo911","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billbo911/{size}/110890_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T15:55:25.221Z","cooked":"

This would be an excellent option! Deffinately a step in the “right” direction. We really don’t want to add additional burdens on the volunteers. That said, most of the CSA’s I have worked with in the last 20 years would have no issue with Linux.

cjb:

one operating system is hard enough

Hear me out, FIRST makes a Linux based FRCOS, with all the FRC software needed. No longer have to worry about windows update

I also agree with @billbo911 here. I think this would be a great option but, I don’t know if NI would want to even make these versions in the first place.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":120,"updated_at":"2025-07-24T16:00:47.528Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":533,"readers_count":532,"score":111.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504602,"topic_slug":"systemcore-please-support-linux","display_username":"CJ Brandi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4760,"username":"billbo911","name":"billbo911","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billbo911/{size}/110890_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73447,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/systemcore-please-support-linux/504602/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688582,"name":"Devyn Keeney","username":"devyntk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/devyntk/{size}/232053_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T16:16:00.138Z","cooked":"

As an FTA and somebody who does a lot of Linux Networking at my big girl job, I do not want to see Linux as a supported OS for the Driver Station unless we see one, official, supported FRC Distro and none others.

There are many, many, many different ways of configuring Networking alone on Linux, nevertheless the different Desktop Environments with different APIs to handle inputs and more. Even with doing it day in and day out I don’t fully understand the UIs and CLIs of each of these tools, and definitely not enough to debug them inside the time of a cycle. Even with one golden supported distro with things preinstalled and preconfigured, I think it would be a lot to ask your FTAs and CSAs to have to handle multiple different OSes, and frankly, I would much rather just see FIRST give everybody a blue box (bonus points if it’s Linux based, though).

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":120,"updated_at":"2025-07-24T16:16:00.138Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":519,"readers_count":518,"score":508.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504602,"topic_slug":"systemcore-please-support-linux","display_username":"Devyn Keeney","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/i-wish-for-a-blue-box/499142","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"I Wish For A Blue Box","clicks":46},{"url":"https://wiki.archlinux.org/title/Network_configuration#Network_managers","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Network configuration - ArchWiki","clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":24}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24672,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I turned FTC into FRC and all I lost was my sanity"},"post_url":"/t/systemcore-please-support-linux/504602/9","custom_user_title":"I turned FTC into FRC and all I lost was my sanity","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":22},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":24,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688583,"name":"billbo911","username":"billbo911","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billbo911/{size}/110890_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T16:17:16.846Z","cooked":"

With FIRST moving to Systemcore, would NI still provide the DS? I mean, does Systemcore support Labview? If so, NI may still provide the DS, but if not, we would need a new DS. In the latter case, we could hope for a Linux variant.
As for vendor code, Rev Client, TunerX etc., that would be up to each vendor.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":120,"updated_at":"2025-07-24T16:17:16.846Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":476,"readers_count":475,"score":95.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504602,"topic_slug":"systemcore-please-support-linux","display_username":"billbo911","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":73447,"username":"cjb","name":"CJ Brandi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cjb/{size}/266658_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"KN6MPS, WRWZ842"},"post_url":"/t/systemcore-please-support-linux/504602/10","custom_user_title":"KN6MPS, WRWZ842","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688585,"name":"Jonah Bonner","username":"jonahb55","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T16:17:28.680Z","cooked":"
ArchdukeTim:

CTRE was able to get TunerX working on macOS

This is technically true, though in practice the requirements around charging for software make it impractical for us to incorporate the macOS version of Tuner into our workflow. Without no easy way for students to install it on their laptops, we might as well just rely on team-owned DS laptops for running vendor software (or alternative tools for diagnostics).

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":120,"updated_at":"2025-07-24T16:17:48.595Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":460,"readers_count":459,"score":172.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504602,"topic_slug":"systemcore-please-support-linux","display_username":"Jonah Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.advantagescope.org/more-features/phoenix-diagnostics","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Phoenix Diagnostics | AdvantageScope","clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44471,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328M/WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/systemcore-please-support-linux/504602/11","custom_user_title":"6328M/WPILib","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688586,"name":"Isaac Proctor","username":"Isaac-The-Pro","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/isaac-the-pro/{size}/265401_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T16:17:31.206Z","cooked":"

I actually think that’s a great idea! FIRST makes a linux distro(probably debian based), with all the FRC software preinstalled and designed exclusively for that os. It would be free for teams, and linux can run on just about anything, so teams wouldn’t have to pay for expensive windows laptops, and they can easily install it on any laptop they already have. No windows updates or bloatware to worry about, just a yearly os update for any and all new software. This genuinely sounds like a great idea to me

devyntk:

and frankly, I would much rather just see FIRST give everybody a blue box (bonus points if it’s Linux based, though).

With the Raspberry Pi partnership for SystemCore, I’d like to see them give everyone a Raspberry Pi 5 and an SD card image with an “operator interface” distro. Add a monitor and USB-C to the driver stations and either let teams treat the Pi like their laptops or add a switch and have dashboards and such run on a separate computer.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":120,"updated_at":"2025-07-24T16:28:23.903Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":410,"readers_count":409,"score":102.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504602,"topic_slug":"systemcore-please-support-linux","display_username":"billbo911","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24672,"username":"devyntk","name":"Devyn Keeney","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/devyntk/{size}/232053_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"KN6MPS, WRWZ842"},"post_url":"/t/systemcore-please-support-linux/504602/14","custom_user_title":"KN6MPS, WRWZ842","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688608,"name":"Devyn Keeney","username":"devyntk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/devyntk/{size}/232053_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T16:36:26.454Z","cooked":"

In my ideal world, it’s something a lot more compact and plug and play than that, but this is already getting awfully close to @guineawheek’s blue box proposal anyway. In short, what I want:

  • An robust, durable case that i can shove in a backpack or give to a 7th grader on a sugar high and not worry about it breaking (a loose rpi does not fit this at all)
  • An embedded touchscreen that boots up into some basic interface (skipping all the linux weirdness) which allows you to select your opmode, configure your team number, see the current IP configuration, or whatever else.
  • USB ports for joysticks/whatever.
  • An upstream FMS ethernet port to connect to the field at competitions, or connect to the internet at home (this will make sense in a second)
  • A wifi chip that allow for direct DS-Systemcore comms at home, or even generating the wifi networks for wireless home practice. Given this won’t be battery powered, getting 6ghz on this should be easier than the VH-109.
  • A “downstream” interface for a laptop or other device of your choosing. Ideally this offers both an ethernet port and a USB port that acts as an ethernet adapter, so you have the choice of whatever you want for your driver station dashboard runner (and it’s not longer in the critical path)
  • A big ol’ status light like an RSL that’s just another good safety measure for seeing whether it’s enabled (or even on).

Isaac-The-Pro:

they can easily install it on any laptop they already have.

Genuine question:
Is the Linux desktop story for pervasive hardware support that good now? It’s been a while since I’ve run Linux on a laptop, but I distinctly remember all kinds of research and aggravation to make sure the hardware you chose was well-supported by Linux, that it fully supported power management, sleep states, suspend/hibernate, etc. For a desktop, a lot of the same was true, but it’s obviously way easier to just change out a component that isn’t well-supported.

If a team gets a laptop donated, chances are extremely high that it supports Windows, for obvious reasons.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":120,"updated_at":"2025-07-24T17:07:16.895Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":372,"readers_count":371,"score":114.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504602,"topic_slug":"systemcore-please-support-linux","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/systemcore-please-support-linux/504602/16","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688628,"name":"","username":"some-guy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/some-guy/{size}/236378_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T17:16:21.184Z","cooked":"

IME, (using desktop Linux on various distributions and laptops for over three years) Linux does indeed support almost everything on the planet. Pretty much the only thing I’ve heard has issues is certain Nvidia cards, but even so, I’m typing this on wayland with a GTX 1650 in my laptop, which for a long time was considered unusable. Same goes for my desktop with an RTX 3070. Support only gets better every day, and it’s very very very rare that you’ll find a computer wholly incompatible with Linux, if that’s even possible to find.

billbo911:

The Blue Box reference is AWESOME!! Thanks for the flashback.
Yes, that would make all things DS, simplier, but lacked any support for Vision feedback.

The point of the neo-blue box proposal is to separate out the needs of robot control and safety (wanting a closed, standardized, easily replaceable system) from those of dashboards (which want infinite configurability on the team side). In my blue box proposal, you can still plug in a computer into the blue box to get vision feedback or act as a dashboard visualizer.

By separating concerns, you can have your dashboards written in Haskell running NixOS, but FTAs can still throw a new brick at you if your DS brick dies, and now don’t have to know everything about Windows networking to get robots controllable on a field. The driver station becomes really good at being a driver station and the dashboard becomes really good at being a dashboard, instead of the current sketchy hybrid approach.

guineawheek:

your DS brick

I didn’t participate in the blue box days, but I don’t get why we would want teams 97, 4322, and 9068 to each bring their own team blue box to the field?

I get the need for teams to have them at the workshop (and maybe in the pits), but it seems like the field rather than the teams could “own” the blue boxes used at the event.

The biggest advantage I can think of is that you would only have to plug in power and Ethernet instead of some number of USB cables that need to be in exactly the right ports or your robot won’t work.
